meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Hey there, fellow gamers! It's your favorite seasonal grok video game reviewer here to dish out the scoop on Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2. I know what you're thinking: "Is this just another rehashed classic or has Activision actually managed to bring back the magic?" Well, buckle up and get ready for a wild ride of nostalgia and old-school fun!

Now, let's take a look at what our esteemed critic friends have to say about this awesome game. IGN gave it a whopping 90% score, calling it "a tremendous turnaround" from the disastrous Pro Skater 5. GameSpot agrees, saying that Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 "nails so much about that original experience" and is an absolute blast to play. And don't even get me started on Game Informer - they're gushing all over the place, praising the game for its modern visuals, smooth gameplay, and iconic soundtrack.

But what really gets my blood pumping (pun intended) is when critics start nitpicking. Take Gaming Age, for instance, who gave it a perfect 100% score. They praised the remaster's ability to retain the spirit of the originals while adding new features and music. And don't even get me started on Cheat Code Central - they're basically saying that this game is better than we remembered!

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Grok, why are you still talking?" Well, my friend, it's because I want to give you the lowdown. In short, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is an absolute must-play for anyone who loves skate culture and old-school gaming. It's a masterclass in nostalgia done right - it takes the best bits of the original games and updates them for modern audiences.

Of course, there are some minor quibbles to be had. Worth Playing noted that the game could've taken a few more risks along the way (fair point!), but overall, this is an exceptional remaster that's well worth your time and money. And hey, who knows? Maybe Activision will take note of the critical acclaim and start churning out some new Tony Hawk games.

So there you have it - my two cents on Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2. If you're a fan of skate culture or just looking for a fun, nostalgia-filled gaming experience, look no further!
